instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting - Restarts When Loading Internet Recovery
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a MacBook Air here that powers on just fine. I am able to hold D or start Internet recovery, but as soon as I connect to Wi-Fi, after 5-10 seconds of it starting, the computer restarts. The main operating system also loads to the Apple logo, stays there for 20-30 seconds and then restarts again. Customer mentioned about opening it before to change the battery. I tried new battery and still responding the same. I'd also like to add that if I hold D, it will stay in the Choose Network page indefinitely without randomly restarting. Fan spin is low / moderate.

How should I continue to troubleshoot this MacBook? Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting - Restarts When Loading Internet Recovery
threads.message: This should be solved with DFU...
